1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 2 ^ Confitēminī Dominō in cittarā
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: in psaltēriō decem chordārum psallite illī. ^ Give praise to the Lord on the harp
sing to him with the psaltery, the instrument of ten strings.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 3 ^ Cantāte eī canticum novum
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: bene psallite eī in vōciferātiōne. ^ Sing to him a new canticle, sing well unto him with a loud noise.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 4 ^ Quia rēctum est verbum Dominī, et omnia opera ejus in fidē. ^ For the word of the Lord is right, and all his works are done with faithfulness.
5 ^ Dīligit misericordiam et jūdicium
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: misericordiā Dominī plēna est terra. ^ He loveth mercy and judgment
the earth is full of the mercy of the Lord.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 6 ^ Verbō Dominī caelī firmātī sunt, et spīritū ōris ejus omnis virtūs eōrum
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: ^ By the word of the Lord the heavens were established, and all the power of them by the spirit of his mouth

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 7 ^ congregans sīcut in utre aquās maris
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: pōnens in tēsaurīs abissōs. ^ gathering together the waters of the sea as in a vessel
laying up the depths in storehouses.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 8 ^ Timeat Dominum omnis terra
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: ab eō autem commoveantur omnēs inhabitantēs orbem. ^ Let all the earth fear the Lord
let then all the inhabitants of the world be in awe of him.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 9 ^ Quoniam ipse dīxit, et facta sunt
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: ipse mandāvit, et creāta sunt. ^ For he spoke and they were made
he commanded, and they were created.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 10 ^ Dominus dissipat consilia gentium
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: reprobat autem cōgitātiōnēs populōrum, et reprobat consilia principum. ^ The Lord bringeth to nought the counsels of nations
moreover he rejecteth the devices of people, and casteth away the counsels of princes.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 11 ^ Consilium autem Dominī in aeternum manet
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: cōgitātiōnēs cordis ejus in generātiōne et generātiōnem. ^ But the counsel of the Lord standeth for ever
the thoughts of his heart to all generations.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 12 ^ Beāta gens cujus est Dominus Deus ejus
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: populus quem ēlēgit in hērēditātem sibi. ^ Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord
the people whom he hath chosen for his inheritance.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 13 ^ Dē caelō respexit Dominus
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: vīdit omnēs fīliōs hominum. ^ The Lord hath looked from heaven
he hath beheld all the sons of men.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 14 ^ Dē praeparātō habitāculō suō respexit super omnēs quī habitant terram. ^ From his habitation which he hath prepared he hath looked upon all that dwell on the earth.
15 ^ Quī fīnxit sigillātim corda eōrum
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: quī intellegit omnia opera eōrum. ^ He who hath made the hearts of every one of them

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 16 ^ Nōn salvātur rēx per multam virtūtem, et gigās nōn salvābitur in multitūdine virtūtis suae. ^ The king is not saved by a great army, nor shall the giant be saved by his own great strength.
17 ^ Fallāx equus ad salūtem
rēctōs decet collaudātiō. ^ Rejoice, O: in abundantiā autem virtūtis suae nōn salvābitur. ^ Vain is the horse for safety
neither shall he be saved by the abundance of his strength.

1 ^ Exsultāte, jūstī, in Dominō: 18 ^ Ecce oculī Dominī super metuentēs eum, et in eīs, quī spērant super misericordiā ejus. ^ Behold the eyes of the Lord are on them that fear him, and on them that hope in his mercy.
19 ^ Ut ēruat ā morte animās eōrum, et alat eōs in famē. ^ To deliver their souls from death, and feed them in famine.
20 ^ Anima nostra sustinet Dominum, quoniam adjūtor et prōtector noster est. ^ Our soul waiteth for the Lord, for he is our helper and protector.
21 ^ Quia in eō laetābitur cor nostrum, et in nōmine sanctō ejus spērāvimus. ^ For in him our heart shall rejoice, and in his holy name we have trusted.
22 ^ Fīat misericordia tua, Domine, super nōs, quemadmodum spērāvimus in tē. ^ Let thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, as we have hoped in thee.
